subject: Behaviour of toll staff engaged by the toll agencies/contractors
text: HRrlu Tezy TTHNf   urfeas7u 519 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 m1 (7st ghar7 3 TITAM HT4) 'F Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 A1 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 5-5 Qd 6, #ae7-10, ETrTI, T frrhl-110075 G-5 & 6,Sector-10, Dwarka New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn: 27.05.2013 PQLICY MAITERS TECHNICAL (134/2013) [Decision tqken wn FileNo NHAILLO13CQ42013-14-Misc) Repeated references/complaints about the incidents of misbehaviour of toll staff   engaged by the toll agencies/contractors with the road users/representatives of the public are being received: 2. As per provisions in Article 46 of the Concession Agreement for the BOTIDBFOT/OMT projects and clause 13 (a) & (e) of the contract agreement of user fee collection contracts of public funded/Annuity toll plazas, the personnel and toll staff have to behave with courtesy without indulging into any argument/hot discussion: 3, Regional officers (ROs) and Project Directors (PDs) are requested to issue necessary instructions in this reyard on a regular interval, necessary directions to toll collection agencies/contractors in writing as well as through their visits to the toll plazas. In case such incidents repeatedly come to the notice of the ROs and PDs, stern action should be taken against the toll collection agencies including termination of the contracts as per provisions applicable: 4 This issues with approval of the Chairman: (V.K Sharma) Chief General Manager (Coord:) To, Alloficers andemployees ot HQ/ROS[PIUs[CMUs/Site Qffices R1 RT NHAI key
